unnormalised: Okay, so I've been seeing a lot of questions about these internet terms lately, especially from my parents and chachis on WhatsApp. Like, what does "IYKYK" even mean? My younger cousin explained it to me, and it's basically "If You Know, You Know." Simple, right? But then you've got others like "TBT" (Throwback Thursday) and "OOTD" (Outfit of the Day) that are all over Instagram.
normalised: Okay, so I've been seeing a lot of questions about these internet terms lately, especially from my parents and chachis on WhatsApp. Like, what does "I-Y-K-Y-K" even mean? My younger cousin explained it to me, and it's basically "If You Know, You Know." Simple, right? But then you've got others like "T-B-T" (Throwback Thursday) and "O-O-T-D" (Outfit of the Day) that are all over Instagram.

unnormalised: Honestly, it can feel like learning a whole new language sometimes! Then there's the whole "DM" thing - Direct Message. My mom thought it meant 'Dear Me'! ðŸ˜‚ And don't even get me started on "LOL," "LMAO," and "ROFL." I still mix those up. But seriously, understanding these abbreviations is becoming essential, especially if you're trying to keep up with trends or just understand what younger folks are saying online.
normalised: Honestly, it can feel like learning a whole new language sometimes! Then there's the whole "D-M" thing - Direct Message. My mom thought it meant 'Dear Me'! Laughing with tears of joy! And don't even get me started on "L-O-L," "L-M-A-O," and "R-O-F-L." I still mix those up. But seriously, understanding these abbreviations is becoming essential, especially if you're trying to keep up with trends or just understand what younger folks are saying online.

unnormalised: Also, remember those old chat rooms? We used "ASAP" (As Soon As Possible) all the time! I think it's a generational thing; like we're adopting newer and newer lingo all the time! Nowadays you hear more about "FOMO" (Fear Of Missing Out) than anything else!
normalised: Also, remember those old chat rooms? We used "A-S-A-P" (As Soon As Possible) all the time! I think it's a generational thing; like we're adopting newer and newer lingo all the time! Nowadays you hear more about "F-O-M-O" (Fear Of Missing Out) than anything else!

unnormalised: So, yeah, the internet is full of jargon, but don't be afraid to Google things! It's how I learned 90% of this stuff. And maybe ask your kids or younger relatives - they'll probably be happy to explain. Good luck navigating the world of "internet speak!"
normalised: So, yeah, the internet is full of jargon, but don't be afraid to Google things! It's how I learned ninety percent of this stuff. And maybe ask your kids or younger relatives - they'll probably be happy to explain. Good luck navigating the world of "internet speak!"
